net.imglib2.cache.queue

Class FetcherThreads

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.imglib2.cache.queue.FetcherThreads

  • public class FetcherThreads
extends Object
    TODO revise javadoc A set of threads that load data. Each thread does the following in a loop:
    1. Take the next key from a queue.
    2. Try loading the key's data (retry until that succeeds).
    FetcherThreads are employed by the cache to asynchronously load values.

    TODO Add shutdown() method.

    Author:
    Tobias Pietzsch <tobias.pietzsch@gmail.com>

    • Constructor Detail

      • FetcherThreads

        public FetcherThreads(BlockingFetchQueues<Callable<?>> queue,
                      int numFetcherThreads)
        Create (and start) a set of fetcher threads.

        Fetcher threads are named Fetcher-0 ... Fetcher-n.

        Parameters:
        queue - the queue from which request keys are taken.
        numFetcherThreads - how many parallel fetcher threads to start.

      • FetcherThreads

        public FetcherThreads(BlockingFetchQueues<Callable<?>> queue,
                      int numFetcherThreads,
                      IntFunction<String> threadIndexToName)
        Create (and start) a set of fetcher threads.
        Parameters:
        queue - the queue from which request keys are taken.
        numFetcherThreads - how many parallel fetcher threads to start.
        threadIndexToName - a function for naming fetcher threads (takes an index and returns a name).

    • Method Detail

      • pauseFor

        public void pauseFor(long ms)
        Pause all Fetcher threads for the specified number of milliseconds.

      • pauseUntil

        public void pauseUntil(long timeMillis)
        pause all Fetcher threads until the given time (see System.currentTimeMillis()).

      • wakeUp

        public void wakeUp()
        Wake up all Fetcher threads immediately. This ends any pauseFor(long) and pauseUntil(long) set earlier.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
